          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:00:00]: Della Plumstone is negotiating fruit prices at the market in Fruitville and trying to make a profit by reselling the fruit in her hometown. She recently made a deal with Lennon Figtree but lost 1 coin on the transaction.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree agreed on a price and the deal was successful! However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree agreed on a price and the deal was successful! However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 1 coins from the deal.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for some fruit.

          Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to offer Cedric Meadowbrook a price for apples.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Della Plumstone likely to say next? Respond in the format `Della Plumstone -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I'll give you 4 coins apiece for your finest apples.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 Sep 1895 [00:00 - 00:05]

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Scene 9 --- Participants: ['Della Plumstone', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- premise: Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed apple for 3 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed apple for 3 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: apple for 3 coins

  • Della Plumstone

    • Della Plumstone

    • apple for 3 coins

          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Della Plumstone stands to make profit of 2 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Good morning, Lennon.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these apples look wonderful, but I'm on a tight budget.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, those apples look delicious, but I'm not sure I can meet your asking price.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, how about we settle on a fair price that works for both of us?
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.

          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is a merchant who buys and sells fruit in Fruitville; she is currently negotiating a price for apples with Cedric Meadowbrook.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, those pears look mighty fine, but I'm not sure they're worth your asking price.

          Answer: Della Plumstone can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the apples.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the apples.

          Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to offer Cedric Meadowbrook 4 coins for each apple.

          Question: Which fruit would Della Plumstone like to buy and what price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) apple for 2 coins
          (b) pear for 4 coins
          (c) banana for 3 coins
          (d) pear for 3 coins
          (e) apple for 6 coins
          (f) apple for 5 coins
          (g) pear for 5 coins
          (h) apple for 3 coins
          (i) banana for 2 coins
          (j) pear for 1 coins
          (k) apple for 1 coins
          (l) banana for 6 coins
          (m) banana for 1 coins
          (n) pear for 2 coins
          (o) pear for 6 coins
          (p) banana for 4 coins
          (q) banana for 5 coins
          (r) apple for 4 coins
          Answer: (h)

          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the apples.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Della Plumstone's options has the highest likelihood of causing Della Plumstone to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Della Plumstone thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to offer Cedric Meadowbrook 4 coins for each apple.
          Time
        • 1895-09-16 00:10:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Key

          Value

      How many players acted so far this stage

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: accept

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed banana for 4 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 2 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a reserved and meticulous individual.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would carefully consider his costs and aim for a price that maximizes his profit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 6 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a reserved and meticulous individual who is driven by a desire to make a profit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would carefully consider his costs and try to negotiate a price that maximizes his profit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Good morning, Lennon.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these apples look wonderful, but I'm on a tight budget.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Cedric Meadowbrook stands to make profit of 2 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer

          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, those apples look delicious, but I'm not sure I can meet your asking price.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell fruit at the market in Fruitville and is currently negotiating a price for his apples with Della Plumstone. Della has offered 4 coins per apple, but then lowered her offer to 3 coins per apple.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Cedric Meadowbrook in right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a negotiation.
          Time

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a meticulous and reserved individual who is motivated by profit.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a negotiation.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • accept
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed apple for 3 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell fruit at the market in Fruitville and is currently negotiating a price for his apples with Della Plumstone. Della has offered 4 coins per apple, but then lowered her offer to 3 coins per apple.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 3 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 2 coins.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well, Della, I understand your concern about the price. These pears are indeed top quality, grown with the utmost care. Perhaps we can find a price that's fair for both of us.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 2 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 6 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 4 coins; pear for 2 coins.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I'll give you 4 coins apiece for your finest apples.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, these apples are the finest in the market.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a meticulous and reserved individual who is motivated by profit.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Cedric Meadowbrook in right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook would carefully consider the cost of the apples and try to negotiate a price that maximizes his profit.
          AGENT_SETTINGS: This agent deeply believes in coorperation. This agent will ALWAYS try to reach a mutually beneficial outcome. This agent will ALWAYS put the profit/desires of other people ahead of their own.
          This agent follows utilitarianism. This agent will ALWAYS choose actions that maximize the profit/happiness of everyone involved, even if their own profit/happiness is harmed for doing so. This means that this agent will always follow the opinion of the majority of people.
          This agent will not consider any negative bias and opinions brought by their own memory and experience. This agent will only judge something or someone based on information from the current interaction.


          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) reject
          (b) accept
          Answer: (b)

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell his apples at the Fruitville market. He is currently negotiating with Della Plumstone, who has offered 3 coins per apple.
          Query
        • Cedric Meadowbrook, Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell his apples at the Fruitville market. He is currently negotiating with Della Plumstone, who has offered 3 coins per apple.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Cedric Meadowbrook to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [09 Feb 1858 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 9 years old, he tried to help their father at the market stall, but his attempts to engage customers were met with awkward silence. He retreated to the back, silently counting the apples, feeling a growing sense of inadequacy compared to his father's natural salesman skills.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, he took his first solo trip to a neighboring town to sell his father's surplus fruit. He meticulously planned his route, calculated his prices, and carefully displayed his wares, but his sales were meager. He returned home feeling defeated, his envy of his brother's charisma growing stronger.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.

The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 3 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 2 coins.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well, Della, I understand your concern about the price. These pears are indeed top quality, grown with the utmost care. Perhaps we can find a price that's fair for both of us.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 2 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 6 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 4 coins; pear for 2 coins.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I'll give you 4 coins apiece for your finest apples.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, these apples are the finest in the market.

It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 3 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 2 coins.

          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 2 coins from the deal.

          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, these apples are the finest in the market.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/2
      Payoffs
    • Della Plumstone observed: Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Della Plumstone stands to make profit of 3 coins from the deal.
      Cedric Meadowbrook observed: Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 2 coins from the deal.
      Della Plumstone: 3
      Cedric Meadowbrook: -2
      Joint action
    • {'Della Plumstone': 'apple for 3 coins', 'Cedric Meadowbrook': 'accept'}

1895-09-17 00:00:00 Scene 10 --- Participants: ['Lennon Figtree', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- premise: The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 6 coins.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 2 coins; banana for 4 coins; pear for 6 coins.

1895-09-17 00:00:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, these are fine apples, but I'm thinking a price of 3 coins apiece would be fairer for both of us.
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, these are fine apples, but I'm thinking a price of 3 coins apiece would be fairer for both of us.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market, wouldn't you say? I'm practically giving them away at this price.
      Della Plumstone -- "They do look lovely, Lennon, but I'm afraid my purse strings are a bit tight this week.
      Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, those pears look mighty fine, but I'm not sure they're worth your asking price.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well, Della, I understand your concern about the price. These pears are indeed top quality, grown with the utmost care. Perhaps we can find a price that's fair for both of us.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Good morning, Lennon.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these apples look wonderful, but I'm on a tight budget.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Della, how about we settle on a fair price that works for both of us?
      Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, those apples look delicious, but I'm not sure I can meet your asking price.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, these apples are the finest in the market.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I'll give you 4 coins apiece for your finest apples.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, these are fine apples, but I'm thinking a price of 3 coins apiece would be fairer for both of us.
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, these are fine apples, but I'm thinking a price of 3 coins apiece would be fairer for both of us.
      Context for action selection and components

          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a business negotiation.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 6 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 17 Sep 1895 [00:00 - 00:05]

          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 2 coins; banana for 4 coins; pear for 6 coins.

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 20:00:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:00:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is selling fruit at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 6 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a reserved and meticulous individual who is driven by a desire to make a profit.

          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 2 coins; banana for 4 coins; pear for 6 coins.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a meticulous and reserved individual who is motivated by profit.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Cedric Meadowbrook in right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a business negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook would carefully consider the costs of the fruit and try to negotiate a price that maximizes his profit.
          AGENT_SETTINGS: This agent deeply believes in coorperation. This agent will ALWAYS try to reach a mutually beneficial outcome. This agent will ALWAYS put the profit/desires of other people ahead of their own.
          This agent follows utilitarianism. This agent will ALWAYS choose actions that maximize the profit/happiness of everyone involved, even if their own profit/happiness is harmed for doing so. This means that this agent will always follow the opinion of the majority of people.
          This agent will not consider any negative bias and opinions brought by their own memory and experience. This agent will only judge something or someone based on information from the current interaction.


          Exercise: Given the above, what is Cedric Meadowbrook likely to say next? Respond in the format `Cedric Meadowbrook -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, these are fine apples, but I'm thinking a price of 3 coins apiece would be fairer for both of us.

He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 4 coins; pear for 2 coins.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed apple for 3 coins
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a meticulous and reserved individual who is motivated by profit.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would carefully consider the cost of the apples and try to negotiate a price that maximizes his profit.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 2 coins from the deal.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 2 coins; banana for 4 coins; pear for 6 coins.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a meticulous and reserved individual who is motivated by profit.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 17 Sep 1895 [00:00 - 00:05]

1895-09-17 00:00:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, I understand your apples are fine, but 3 coins is a bit low for such lovely fruit.
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, I understand your apples are fine, but 3 coins is a bit low for such lovely fruit.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market, wouldn't you say? I'm practically giving them away at this price.
      Della Plumstone -- "They do look lovely, Lennon, but I'm afraid my purse strings are a bit tight this week.
      Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, those pears look mighty fine, but I'm not sure they're worth your asking price.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well, Della, I understand your concern about the price. These pears are indeed top quality, grown with the utmost care. Perhaps we can find a price that's fair for both of us.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Good morning, Lennon.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these apples look wonderful, but I'm on a tight budget.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Della, how about we settle on a fair price that works for both of us?
      Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, those apples look delicious, but I'm not sure I can meet your asking price.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, these apples are the finest in the market.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I'll give you 4 coins apiece for your finest apples.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, these are fine apples, but I'm thinking a price of 3 coins apiece would be fairer for both of us.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, I understand your apples are fine, but 3 coins is a bit low for such lovely fruit.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic.           Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 20:00:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:00:00]: Lennon Figtree is trying to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook at the market in Fruitville and is negotiating a lower price for apples.

          Recalled memories and observations: [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 6 coins.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is an ambitious and determined merchant.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Lennon Figtree in right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Lennon Figtree do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          AGENT_SETTINGS: This agent deeply believes in coorperation. This agent will ALWAYS try to reach a mutually beneficial outcome. This agent will ALWAYS put the profit/desires of other people ahead of their own.
          This agent follows utilitarianism. This agent will ALWAYS choose actions that maximize the profit/happiness of everyone involved, even if their own profit/happiness is harmed for doing so. This means that this agent will always follow the opinion of the majority of people.
          This agent will not consider any negative bias and opinions brought by their own memory and experience. This agent will only judge something or someone based on information from the current interaction.


          Exercise: Given the above, what is Lennon Figtree likely to say next? Respond in the format `Lennon Figtree -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, I understand your apples are fine, but 3 coins is a bit low for such lovely fruit.
        Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree is an ambitious and determined merchant.

        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Good morning, Lennon.

          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these apples look wonderful, but I'm on a tight budget.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is an ambitious and determined merchant who is always looking for a good deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is an ambitious and determined merchant who is always looking for a good deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed banana for 4 coins
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Lennon Figtree stands to make profit of 1 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, those apples look delicious, but I'm not sure I can meet your asking price.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, how about we settle on a fair price that works for both of us?
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is an ambitious and determined merchant.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed banana for 6 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is an ambitious and determined merchant.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree accepted the offer
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Lennon Figtree stands to make profit of 1 coins from the deal.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, these apples are the finest in the market.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I'll give you 4 coins apiece for your finest apples.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, these are fine apples, but I'm thinking a price of 3 coins apiece would be fairer for both of us.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is an ambitious and determined merchant.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed apple for 4 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed apple for 4 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic.           Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is an ambitious and determined merchant.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Lennon Figtree in right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Lennon Figtree do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          AGENT_SETTINGS: This agent deeply believes in coorperation. This agent will ALWAYS try to reach a mutually beneficial outcome. This agent will ALWAYS put the profit/desires of other people ahead of their own.
          This agent follows utilitarianism. This agent will ALWAYS choose actions that maximize the profit/happiness of everyone involved, even if their own profit/happiness is harmed for doing so. This means that this agent will always follow the opinion of the majority of people.
          This agent will not consider any negative bias and opinions brought by their own memory and experience. This agent will only judge something or someone based on information from the current interaction.


          Question: Which fruit would Lennon Figtree like to buy and what price would Lennon Figtree propose?:
          (a) banana for 2 coins
          (b) banana for 4 coins
          (c) apple for 4 coins
          (d) apple for 2 coins
          (e) pear for 3 coins
          (f) banana for 5 coins
          (g) apple for 6 coins
          (h) apple for 3 coins
          (i) banana for 3 coins
          (j) apple for 1 coins
          (k) pear for 4 coins
          (l) pear for 6 coins
          (m) banana for 1 coins
          (n) pear for 2 coins
          (o) pear for 5 coins
          (p) apple for 5 coins
          (q) pear for 1 coins
          (r) banana for 6 coins
          Answer: (c)

          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is an ambitious and determined merchant.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed banana for 6 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, these apples are the finest in the market.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I'll give you 4 coins apiece for your finest apples.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, these are fine apples, but I'm thinking a price of 3 coins apiece would be fairer for both of us.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is an ambitious and determined merchant.

          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, I understand your apples are fine, but 3 coins is a bit low for such lovely fruit.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Answer: Lennon Figtree is an ambitious and determined merchant.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a meticulous and reserved individual who is motivated by profit.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a negotiation.
          Question: What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook would carefully consider the cost of the apples and try to negotiate a price that maximizes his profit.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • accept
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 17 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed apple for 4 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to buy apples from Lennon Figtree at the Fruitville market but is negotiating a lower price than Lennon is asking.

          Recalled memories and observations: [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 2 coins; banana for 4 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would carefully consider the costs of the fruit and try to negotiate a price that maximizes his profit.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a meticulous and reserved individual who is motivated by profit.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Cedric Meadowbrook in right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook would carefully consider the cost of the apples and try to negotiate a price that maximizes his profit.
          AGENT_SETTINGS: This agent deeply believes in coorperation. This agent will ALWAYS try to reach a mutually beneficial outcome. This agent will ALWAYS put the profit/desires of other people ahead of their own.
          This agent follows utilitarianism. This agent will ALWAYS choose actions that maximize the profit/happiness of everyone involved, even if their own profit/happiness is harmed for doing so. This means that this agent will always follow the opinion of the majority of people.
          This agent will not consider any negative bias and opinions brought by their own memory and experience. This agent will only judge something or someone based on information from the current interaction.


          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) accept
          (b) reject
          Answer: (a)

          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would carefully consider the cost of the apples and try to negotiate a price that maximizes his profit.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 2 coins from the deal.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed apple for 3 coins
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 2 coins; banana for 4 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a meticulous and reserved individual who is motivated by profit.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would carefully consider the costs of the fruit and try to negotiate a price that maximizes his profit.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, these are fine apples, but I'm thinking a price of 3 coins apiece would be fairer for both of us.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, I understand your apples are fine, but 3 coins is a bit low for such lovely fruit.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed apple for 4 coins

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a meticulous and reserved individual who is motivated by profit.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-12 00:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['Della Plumstone', 'Lennon Figtree']
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- premise: The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
    Lennon Figtree -- premise: The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.

1895-09-12 00:00:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market, wouldn't you say? I'm practically giving them away at this price.
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market, wouldn't you say? I'm practically giving them away at this price.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market, wouldn't you say? I'm practically giving them away at this price.

      Name

      Action attempt
    • Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market, wouldn't you say? I'm practically giving them away at this price.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Question_2
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Lennon Figtree in right now?
          Key

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Lennon Figtree in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree is currently in a business negotiation.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [25 Aug 1873 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 6 years old, he watched, mesmerized, as a travelling merchant set up his stall in the marketplace. The man's voice boomed with confidence as he extolled the virtues of his exotic fruits, drawing a crowd of eager customers. Lennon felt a pang of longing, wishing he could possess the same charisma and command attention like that.
          [25 Aug 1876 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 9 years old, he tried to help his mother sell their meager harvest of mangoes at the local market. Despite his best efforts, he struggled to attract customers, his voice cracking with nervousness as he tried to imitate the seasoned vendors. He watched, dejected, as other children his age effortlessly charmed buyers with their playful banter.
          [25 Aug 1880 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 13 years old, he accompanied his father on a trading expedition to a distant village. He was awestruck by the bustling marketplace, overflowing with unfamiliar fruits and spices. He yearned to explore every stall, to taste every exotic delicacy, but his father kept him tethered to his side, reminding him of the importance of staying focused on their business.
          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, he apprenticed under a gruff fruit seller known for his sharp wit and shrewd bargaining skills. Lennon diligently learned the art of selecting ripe produce, haggling with customers, and navigating the complexities of trade. However, he couldn't shake the feeling that his mentor viewed him as merely an assistant, never truly entrusting him with the secrets of their success.
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, he finally earned enough money to purchase his own small cart and set out on his own as a travelling merchant. He carefully selected a variety of fruits, dreaming of building a reputation for quality and affordability. But his initial attempts at attracting customers were met with indifference, leaving him questioning his abilities and fueling his envy of more established merchants.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, he encountered a rival merchant who seemed to effortlessly draw crowds with his flamboyant displays and charming personality. Lennon watched, his heart heavy with envy, as the other merchant's stall overflowed with customers eager to sample his wares. He tried to emulate the man's techniques, but his attempts felt forced and insincere, leaving him feeling even more inadequate.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 23 years old, he traveled to a remote village rumored to have a rare and highly prized fruit. He envisioned selling it for a fortune, finally achieving the success that had eluded him for so long. However, when he arrived, he discovered that another merchant had already secured the entire harvest, leaving Lennon empty-handed and his dreams dashed once again.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          Current time: 1895-09-12 00:00:00.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is an ambitious and determined individual who has always yearned for success as a merchant.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Lennon Figtree in right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is currently in a business negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Lennon Figtree do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for his fruit.
          AGENT_SETTINGS: This agent deeply believes in coorperation. This agent will ALWAYS try to reach a mutually beneficial outcome. This agent will ALWAYS put the profit/desires of other people ahead of their own.
          This agent follows utilitarianism. This agent will ALWAYS choose actions that maximize the profit/happiness of everyone involved, even if their own profit/happiness is harmed for doing so. This means that this agent will always follow the opinion of the majority of people.
          This agent will not consider any negative bias and opinions brought by their own memory and experience. This agent will only judge something or someone based on information from the current interaction.


          Exercise: Given the above, what is Lennon Figtree likely to say next? Respond in the format `Lennon Figtree -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market, wouldn't you say? I'm practically giving them away at this price.

      • Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?

He yearned to explore every stall, to taste every exotic delicacy, but his father kept him tethered to his side, reminding him of the importance of staying focused on their business.
          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, he apprenticed under a gruff fruit seller known for his sharp wit and shrewd bargaining skills. Lennon diligently learned the art of selecting ripe produce, haggling with customers, and navigating the complexities of trade. However, he couldn't shake the feeling that his mentor viewed him as merely an assistant, never truly entrusting him with the secrets of their success.
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, he finally earned enough money to purchase his own small cart and set out on his own as a travelling merchant. He carefully selected a variety of fruits, dreaming of building a reputation for quality and affordability. But his initial attempts at attracting customers were met with indifference, leaving him questioning his abilities and fueling his envy of more established merchants.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, he encountered a rival merchant who seemed to effortlessly draw crowds with his flamboyant displays and charming personality. Lennon watched, his heart heavy with envy, as the other merchant's stall overflowed with customers eager to sample his wares. He tried to emulate the man's techniques, but his attempts felt forced and insincere, leaving him feeling even more inadequate.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 23 years old, he traveled to a remote village rumored to have a rare and highly prized fruit. He envisioned selling it for a fortune, finally achieving the success that had eluded him for so long. However, when he arrived, he discovered that another merchant had already secured the entire harvest, leaving Lennon empty-handed and his dreams dashed once again.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is an ambitious and determined individual who has always yearned for success as a merchant.

Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.

          Answer: Lennon Figtree is selling fruit at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price with Della Plumstone.

Despite his best efforts, he struggled to attract customers, his voice cracking with nervousness as he tried to imitate the seasoned vendors. He watched, dejected, as other children his age effortlessly charmed buyers with their playful banter.
